full_summary:
**Marine Growth Prevention Systems (MGPS) Tender Announcement**

**Title (English & French)**

* Marine Growth Prevention Systems
* Systèmes antiparasitaires marins

**Reference Number & Amendment**

* Reference Number: PW-__ML-066-28821
* Amendment Number: 5

**Solicitation & Tender Information**

* Solicitation Number: F7044-211437/A
* Tender Closing Date: November 18, 2022, 2:00 PM EST
* Expected Contract Start Date: None (TBA)
* Expected Contract End Date: None (TBA)

**Procurement Category & Method**

* Category: Goods and Services (GD)
* Method: Competitive Open Bidding

**Trade Agreements & Regions**

* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Regions of Operation: British Columbia, Nova Scotia, and Newfoundland and Labrador

**Contracting Entity Information**

* Name: Public Works and Government Services Canada
* Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5
* Contact: Daniel Durocher, [daniel.durocher@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:daniel.durocher@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca), (873) 455-3877

**Notice Type & Status**

* Notice Type: Request for Proposal (RFP)
* Notice Status: Exired (as of November 18, 2022)

**Attachment Documents**

* Available for download on the Canada Buy Services [link](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/09/26/4371811f433c5b9bda742ba2755839dc/ABES.PROD.PW__ML.B066.E28821.ATTA003.PDF)

**Tender Description & Requirements**

The Canadian Coast Guards require new Marine Growth Prevention Systems (MGPS) to be procured for offshore fisheries science vessels. The successful bidder will be responsible for delivering one (1) MGPS for the CCGS Jacques Cartier, with options for two (2) additional MGPS for the remaining OFSV vessels. The system must operate on the principle that a low, continuous, or pulsed dose of a biocide will prevent organism survival and growth. The requirement includes all associated Work and Services described in the Statement of Work (SOW).
